definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: There is no light in his home, and the darkness makes people afraid.
sentences.chinese: 他家沒有開燈，黑黢黢的讓人害怕。

sentences.english: Keeping the lights on through the night also reduced the amount of melatonin produced.
sentences.chinese: 整夜保持開燈也會降低褪黑素產生的量。

sentences.english: Remember, there is nothing wrong with sleeping with a night light.
sentences.chinese: 記着，晚上開燈睡覺沒有什麼過錯。

sentences.english: Button with a blue backlight, very beautiful at night Kaideng can not use.
sentences.chinese: 按鍵帶有藍色背光，很漂亮，晚上不開燈也能使用。

sentences.english: If you want to draw attention, turn on the lights.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想引起注意，就開燈。

sentences.english: "You didn't have any lights, " she began.
sentences.chinese: “你們開車怎麼不開燈啊”她開始抱怨道。

sentences.english: Why can’t we turn on the lights?
Later on, I turned on the light and realized there was urine all over the floor. My grandfather's urine.
sentences.chinese: 結果過了一會我開燈才發現地上都是我祖父的尿。

sentences.english: But usually they left it off, and that was worse.
sentences.chinese: 但是他們常常不開燈，這樣的話更遭。

sentences.english: I groped in the darkness. I opened the door and didn't dare to turn on the light.
sentences.chinese: 我在黑暗中摸索着，我打開門，沒敢開燈。

sentences.english: We'll turn the light back on for a second here.
The last light of day was fading in the window, but he did notturn on thelights.
sentences.chinese: 窗外天色已經漸漸全黑了，但他沒開燈。

sentences.english: It's getting dark;put on the light.

definition: 11 pm-1 am (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
to pretend to look happy/to force oneself to smile
